intro: Stenochlaena guineensis, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Stenochlaena guineensis is often cultivated for its starchy rhizomes, which are used as a food source in some regions. Its botanical features make it an important plant in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
